definition[0]: affecting everyone or everything in a situation or organization
example[1]: In July everything we sell is reduced right across the board.
definition[1]: if something happens or is done across the board, it affects everyone in a particular group, place etc
example[2]: The changes will affect local authorities across the board.
example[3]: We find jobs for people right across the board, from chief executives to cleaners.
definition[2]: affecting everyone or everything in an organization or situation
example[4]: They have agreed to production cuts as long as they are across the board.
example[5]: Nursing unions are demanding a 4% across-the-board pay increase.
